item.title: Delisted Psikyo shoot ’em ups for PC to return via rights holder KM-BOX
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Gunbird, Samurai Aces, and Strikers 1945 due out on December 16.

The PC versions of the 12 Psikyo shoot ’em up titles that were delisted from Steam on October 31 will return via rights holder KM-BOX, the company confirmed to Gematsu.

KM-BOX, a South Korean publisher, has held the rights to the Psikyo library since the early 2000s. It granted City Connection the rights to publish the PC versions of these titles for a period of time, but reclaimed those rights as of those year and will now handle those releases directly.

The following three titles are due out on December 16:

  • Gunbird
  • Samurai Aces
  • Strikers 1945

And the following titles will follow at a later date:

  • Gunbird 2
  • Gunbarich
  • Dragon Blaze
  • Samurai Aces Episode II: Tengai
  • Samurai Aces Episode III: Sengoku Cannon
  • Sol Divide
  • Strikers 1945 II
  • Strikers 1945 III
  • Zero Gunner 2


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/delisted-psikyo-shoot-em-ups-for-pc-to-return-via-rights-holder-km-box

item.title: Dragon Quest VII Reimagined character trailer – Aishe
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

A young Roamer determined to restore the Almighty.

Square Enix has released the fifth character trailer for Dragon Quest VII Reimagined, introducing Aishe, a young Roamer determined to restore the Almighty.

Aishe’s character description reads, “A young Roamer woman devoted to the Earth Spirit, determined to restore the Almighty. Skilled in swordsmanship, she is also gifted with a natural talent for dance.”

Dragon Quest VII Reimagined is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on February 5, 2026 worldwide. Read more about the game here here, and here.

Watch the trailer below.

Character Trailer: Aishe
